derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English nægel (noun), næglan (verb), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch nagel and German Nagel, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin unguis and Greek onux

entry.def: A nail is a thin piece of metal with one pointed end and one flat end. You hit the flat end with a hammer in order to push the nail into something such as a wall.

example.ex: A mirror hung on a nail above the washstand...
example.tran: 脸盆架上方用钉子挂着一面镜子。

example.ex: He hammered the nail into the branch.
example.tran: 他把钉子钉到了树枝上。

entry.def: If you nail something somewhere, you fix it there using one or more nails.

example.ex: Frank put the first plank down and nailed it in place...
example.tran: 弗兰克放下第一块厚木板，把它钉在合适的位置上。

example.ex: They nail shut the front door...

entry.def: Your nails are the thin hard parts that grow at the ends of your fingers and toes.

example.ex: Keep your nails short and your hands clean.
example.tran: 常剪指甲，保持双手清洁。

entry.def: To nail someone means to catch them and prove that they have been breaking the law.

example.ex: The prosecution still managed to nail him for robberies at the homes of leading industrialists.
example.tran: 检控方仍设法使其入室抢劫知名实业家们的罪名成立。

entry.tran: 冷酷无情的;铁石心肠的;强硬好斗的
entry.def: If you say that someone is as hard as nails, you mean that they are extremely tough and aggressive, either physically or in their attitude towards other people or other situations.

example.ex: He's a shrewd businessman and hard as nails...
example.tran: 他是一个既精明又铁石心肠的生意人。

example.ex: He simply looked mean and hard as nails.
example.tran: 他看起来既卑鄙又冷酷无情。

entry.def: If you say that someone has hit the nail on the head, you think they are exactly right about something.

example.ex: 'I think it would civilize people a bit more if they had decent conditions.' — 'I think you've hit the nail on the head.'
example.tran: “我认为，如果人们有良好的环境，就会更有教养一点。”——“我想你说到点子上了。”

means.word_mean: 1. horny plate covering and protecting part of the dorsal surface of the digits
2. a thin pointed piece of metal that is hammered into materials as a fastener
3. a former unit of length for cloth equal to 1/16 of a yard
1. attach something somewhere by means of nails;

sentences.sentence: "He nailed down a spot at Harvard"
"can you pinpoint the position of the enemy?"
"The chemists could not nail the identity of the chromosome"

example.en: Old nail-em-and-jail-em is going to be knocking at your door any day now.

sentences.en: He drove in a nail with one stroke of the hammer.
sentences.cn: 他一锤就把钉子敲进去了。

sentences.en: I have tried to discourage him from biting nails.
sentences.cn: 我曾劝阻他不要咬指甲。

sentences.en: My nails are too long, I must file them down.
sentences.cn: 我的指甲太长了, 必须把它们锉平。

sentences.en: He nailed boards together to make a box.
sentences.cn: 他把几块木板钉在一起做了一个箱子。

sentences.en: Has the police nailed the man?

jushi.english: Do not throw these nails away, they may come in use one day.
jushi.chinese: 不要把这些钩子扔了,也许有一天能用着它们。

jushi.english: The carpenter will drive every nail home before he pronounces the work finished.
jushi.chinese: 木匠要把每根钉子钉好了才会说工作做完了。

jushi.english: We must break the child of his habit of biting his nails.
jushi.chinese: 我们必须使这个孩子改掉咬指甲的习惯。
